Class UserInterface

java.lang.Object
userInterface.UserInterface
public class UserInterface extends Object
UserInterface

Initializes and manages the main application window using two nested horizontal JSplitPane layouts:

  • Main split (left/right): left side shows the SimulationViewer, right side hosts a secondary split.
  • Secondary split (left/right): left side shows the InfoWin (results/status tabs); right side shows the AttributeViewer.
Provides toggle helpers to collapse/expand the simulation viewer and the attribute viewer regions.
Author:
ShiuJia

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    UserInterface()
    Constructs a new UserInterface instance, initializes its components, and makes the main application window visible.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    extendAttributeViewer()
    Toggles the visibility of the attribute viewer by adjusting the divider of the right split pane (horizontal).
    void
    extendSimulationViewer()
    Toggles the visibility of the simulation viewer area by adjusting the main split pane divider (horizontal).
    AttributeViewer
    getAttributes()
    Returns the attributes panel component placed at the bottom split pane.
    JSplitPane
    getBottomSplitpane()
    Returns the nested right-hand horizontal split pane that contains the results window (left) and the attribute viewer (right).
    JFrame
    getFrame()
    Returns the main application window frame.
    InfoWin
    getInfoWin()
    Returns the information window component (results/status) placed on the left side of the nested (right) split pane.
    SimulationViewer
    getSimulationViewer()
    Returns the simulation viewer component (top area) that renders the simulation content.
    void
    setSimulationViewerMinimumWidth(int minWidthPx)
    Allows external/runtime adjustment of the minimum width of the SimulationViewer panel.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserInterface

      public UserInterface()
      Constructs a new UserInterface instance, initializes its components, and makes the main application window visible.

  • Method Details

    • extendSimulationViewer

      public void extendSimulationViewer()
      Toggles the visibility of the simulation viewer area by adjusting the main split pane divider (horizontal).

    • extendAttributeViewer

      public void extendAttributeViewer()
      Toggles the visibility of the attribute viewer by adjusting the divider of the right split pane (horizontal). If currently expanded, collapse completely; if collapsed, expand leaving a fixed 200px width for the attribute viewer.

    • getSimulationViewer

      public SimulationViewer getSimulationViewer()
      Returns the simulation viewer component (top area) that renders the simulation content.
      Returns:
      the SimulationViewer instance

    • getFrame

      public JFrame getFrame()
      Returns the main application window frame.
      Returns:
      the JFrame hosting the UI

    • getAttributes

      public AttributeViewer getAttributes()
      Returns the attributes panel component placed at the bottom split pane.
      Returns:
      the AttributeViewer instance

    • getInfoWin

      public InfoWin getInfoWin()
      Returns the information window component (results/status) placed on the left side of the nested (right) split pane.
      Returns:
      the InfoWin instance

    • getBottomSplitpane

      public JSplitPane getBottomSplitpane()
      Returns the nested right-hand horizontal split pane that contains the results window (left) and the attribute viewer (right). External callers may further customize divider positions or component visibility.
      Returns:
      the nested JSplitPane (right side of the main layout)

    • setSimulationViewerMinimumWidth

      public void setSimulationViewerMinimumWidth(int minWidthPx)
      Allows external/runtime adjustment of the minimum width of the SimulationViewer panel. Also ensures current divider location is not left smaller than the new minimum.
      Parameters:
      minWidthPx - desired minimum width in pixels (clamped to >=50)
